events.title: 1904 U.S. creates Panama for a canal
events.summary: America encourages Panama’s ‘independence’ only so it can dig a shortcut.

events.title: 1930s Dust Bowl
events.summary: Farmers over-plough the plains until the plains fight back.

events.title: 1947 Marshall Plan (EU rehab fund)

events.title: 1958 China’s Great Leap Forward
events.summary: Mao tries to out-industrialize the West; accidentally starves millions.

events.title: 1969 Moon Landing

events.title: 1972 Watergate Scandal
events.summary: U.S. president caught spying on own democracy like dollar-store KGB.

events.title: 1980–88 Iran–Iraq War
events.summary: Middle East burns for eight years; no one wins, everyone loses.

events.title: 1994 Rwanda Genocide
events.summary: UN watches genocide, takes notes, does nothing.

events.title: 2013 Snowden NSA leaks

events.title: 2016 Cambridge Analytica scandal

events.title: 2019 COVID-19 outbreak begins
events.summary: Virus leaps from wet market to global paranoia.

events.title: 2003 US Invades Iraq (WMD…?)
events.summary: Looking for weapons; finds insurgency instead.

events.summary: Banks gamble; whole planet goes broke.

events.title: 2011 Arab Spring erupts

events.title: 2016 Brexit Referendum
events.summary: UK votes itself into confusion.

events.title: 2022 Russia invades Ukraine (again)

events.title: Nanjing Massacre

events.title: Operation Barbarossa
events.summary: Germany invades USSR; overextension leads to defeat.

events.title: Soviet invasion of Afghanistan
events.summary: Costly quagmire hastens Soviet decline.

events.title: Chernobyl disaster

events.title: Black Monday stock crash

events.title: Dot-com bubble bursts
events.summary: Speculative tech boom collapses.

events.title: Enron collapse
events.summary: Accounting fraud leads to bankruptcy.

events.title: Global financial crisis
events.summary: Lehman collapse triggers systemic shock.

events.title: Fukushima nuclear disaster

events.title: Sanctions after Crimea annexation

events.title: Full invasion of Ukraine backfires
events.summary: Strong NATO unity, sanctions, and neighbor rearmament.

events.summary: Britain & France secretly carve Middle East like Sunday roast.

events.title: 1957 Treaty of Rome forms EEC

events.title: 1968 Prague Spring crushed

events.title: 2008 Russo–Georgian War

events.title: 2011 Libya NATO intervention

events.title: 2018 France Yellow Vest protests

events.title: 2022 Europe energy panic

events.title: 2023 Dutch farmers burn EU laws

events.title: 1911 Agadir Crisis

events.title: 2014 West Africa Ebola outbreak
events.summary: Virus spreads while WHO faxes slowly.

events.title: 1953 Operation Ajax in Iran

events.title: 1964 Gulf of Tonkin ‘incident’

events.summary: 20-year war ends exactly like USSR’s attempt.

events.summary: US arms ‘good guys’ who later join ISIS.

events.title: 2014 NATO builds up Baltic forces

events.title: 2016 US accuses Russia of election meddling
events.summary: America shocked someone used its own playbook.

events.title: 2017 Western arms to Saudi Arabia
events.summary: EU/US sell weapons while Yemen burns on TV.

events.title: 2018 Douma chemical attack controversy
events.summary: NATO bombs Syria hours before investigations start.

events.title: 2020 EU arms embargo on Libya (ignored)
events.summary: EU bans weapons… sends them anyway via proxies.

events.title: 2021 AUKUS pact backstabs France

events.title: 2023 Ukraine war funding questions

events.title: 2023 Israel–Gaza escalation

events.title: 2023 Ukraine ‘counteroffensive’ stalls
events.summary: Billions spent, frontlines barely move, optimism leaks like trench water.

events.title: 2024 EU farmers blockade Brussels
events.summary: Tractors vs bureaucracy as green laws strangle foodmakers.

events.title: 2024 US border chaos
events.summary: Democrats and Republicans argue while migrants keep walking.

events.title: 2024 US ‘ban TikTok’ circus

events.title: 2024 Russia–North Korea arms hug
events.summary: Putin hugs Kim to refill shells as Ukraine burns ammo.

events.title: 2024 ICJ genocide case vs Israel
events.summary: World debates words while bombs still fall in Gaza.

events.summary: Leaders warn AI is dangerous… use AI to write speech.

events.summary: Rich lenders talk fairness, still demand interest.

events.title: 2021 Kabul airport chaos

events.title: 1904 US invents the term ‘Banana Republic’

events.title: 1928 Fleming ‘discovers’ penicillin

events.title: 1953 Korean War ‘armistice’
events.summary: Pause button pressed — actual war never technically ended.

events.title: 1965 Condom error boom

events.title: 1984 Bhopal Gas catastrophe

events.summary: Luxury festival turns into survival camp for influencers.

events.title: 1954 Bikini Atoll nuclear test

events.title: 1906 radioactive face cream fad

events.summary: Rumoured parrots trained to mimic voices to fool enemy spies.

events.title: 1990 Berlin Love Parade begins
events.summary: Mass techno street party starts hippie rave era after Cold War.

events.title: 1995 France bans ketchup in schools
events.summary: Government claims ketchup erodes French cuisine values.

events.title: 1998 US towns try banning Pokémon as ‘satanic’
events.summary: Church groups claim Pikachu promotes witchcraft.

events.title: 1909 UK ‘phantom airship’ panic
events.summary: Brits report mysterious zeppelins in sky — military finds nothing.
events.punchline: Early UFO panic before UFO existed.

events.title: 1914 WWI war pigeons decorated as heroes
events.summary: Carrier pigeons deliver battlefield messages → awarded tiny medals.
events.punchline: Feathered soldiers with better service record than humans.

events.title: 1920 Italian ‘War on Mice’ in Tuscany
events.summary: Government launches military op against mouse overpopulation.

events.title: 1930 Kangaroo boxing becomes global circus hit
events.summary: Humans box kangaroos for entertainment — kangaroos often win.

events.title: 1944 US ‘Ghost Army’ deception unit
events.summary: Inflatable tanks and sound recordings trick Nazis on frontline.

events.title: 1951 Color TV deemed communist threat
events.summary: US senators claim red & yellow on-screen spreads communist ideology.

events.title: 1960s USA researches nuclear-powered fish drones
events.summary: DARPA project attempts robotic catfish to spy under rivers.

events.title: 1967 CIA tests ‘Make Love Not War’ gas
events.summary: Experiment to release aphrodisiac on enemy troops to distract them.

events.title: 1973 Belgium tests mail-delivery by cats
events.summary: 37 cats attempted delivering letters — all got distracted.
events.punchline: Postal service goes meow and fails.

events.title: 1980 Romanian ‘talking egg’ pet project
events.summary: Dictator funds creation of toy egg that randomly insults children to ‘build character’.
events.punchline: Egg calls you weak, you grow stronger?

events.title: 1986 Japan mints coins for aliens
events.summary: Japan creates special yen coins in case extraterrestrials need currency.

events.title: 1992 ‘Velvet Divorce’ splits Czechoslovakia
events.summary: Country divides peacefully — beer stronger than politics.
events.punchline: Nation broke up like polite breakup text.

events.title: 1994 UK Parliament sinkhole incident
events.summary: Part of House of Commons floor collapses into centuries-old hidden tunnel.

events.title: 1999 Russia accuses beavers of spying for NATO
events.summary: Officials claim beavers in river had hidden camera devices.
events.punchline: Spy beavers – Cold War furry edition.

events.title: 1903 Spanish ‘hanging duck’ fiesta
events.summary: Villagers try grabbing live ducks hanging over river from boats — many drown.

events.title: 1913 British inflatable trousers craze
events.summary: Inventor sells trousers that expand with air as lifejackets — burst often.

events.title: 1928 USSR laughing gas railway plan
events.summary: Soviets propose spray laughing gas on train commuters to make them patriotic.

events.title: 1934 California frog-post office
events.summary: Small town briefly uses trained frogs to carry tiny letters.
events.punchline: Frogs hated the job — quit en masse.

events.title: 1945 US plans sticky bombs made of glue
events.summary: Prototype bomb sticks to tanks — also sticks to soldiers.

events.title: 1959 France unveils robot chef
events.summary: Robot meant to cook soufflé — burns kitchen regularly.

events.title: 1961 US talking leaflet speaker drop
events.summary: CIA drops leaflets with speakers yelling ‘surrender’ in Vietnamese forests.

events.title: 1970 US rumored mosquito bioweapon test in Cuba
events.summary: Foreign mosquitoes released — Cuba blames CIA for yellow fever outbreak.

events.title: 1978 Paris snail-farming hoax
events.summary: Thousands invest in fake escargot farms based on imaginary futures market.

events.title: 1982 NATO tests ‘sound gun’ using turkey gobbles
events.summary: Device emits loud turkey gobbling to confuse enemy lines.

events.title: 1987 USSR tests inflatable decoy missile shaped like rubber duck
events.summary: Meant to fool satellites; looks ridiculous from air and ground.

events.title: 1993 Russia trains beavers to chew enemy bridges
events.summary: Top-secret program teaches beavers sabotage woodworking.

events.title: 1996 Denmark bacon-ban rumour riots
events.summary: False rumour that bacon will be banned sparks protests in Copenhagen.

events.title: 1998 German magic tree tagging mystery
events.summary: Forests found with mysterious tags hinting ‘trees choose their owners’.

events.title: 2004 EU expands east, builds ‘Fortress Europe’
events.summary: Brussels welcomes new members — then erects fences for everyone else.
events.punchline: Open arms internally — barbed wire externally.

events.title: 2007 EU celebrates itself in Rome
events.summary: Leaders toast peace while discussing new weapon contracts.
events.punchline: Champagne & cluster bombs on same agenda.

events.title: 2011 Schengen agreement cracks during Arab Spring
events.summary: EU loves free movement until refugees show up.

events.title: 2013 FRONTEX starts pushbacks
events.summary: EU border agency accused of illegal migrant dumping in sea.

events.title: 2015 Greece crisis — EU demands austerity
events.summary: EU lectures Greeks on responsibility while selling them submarines.
events.punchline: Bailout terms: cut pensions, keep buying our weapons.

events.title: 2016 EU–Turkey refugee deal
events.summary: EU pays Erdogan billions to keep refugees far away.

events.title: 2019 France sells weapons to Egypt despite torture record
events.summary: Macron waves human rights flag — then signs Rafale jet deal with Sisi.

events.title: 2020 COVID mask hypocrisy
events.summary: Germany seizes masks meant for Italy, lectures about EU solidarity.

events.title: 2021 Belarus ‘weaponises migrants’
events.summary: Lukashenko pushes migrants to Poland — EU acts shocked despite own past.

events.title: 2022 Nord Stream pipeline explosion
events.summary: Mystery sabotage ruins EU gas flow — everyone blames ‘unknown’ actors.

events.title: 2023 EU condemns Russian arrests — ignores own protests beatings
events.summary: Brussels shames Moscow then lets Spanish police crack Catalan skulls.

events.title: 2023 Italy restricts rescue NGOs in Mediterranean
events.summary: Government blocks migrant rescue ships, claims ‘saving lives encourages deaths’.

events.title: 2024 EU carbon tax revolt by farmers
events.summary: EU climate plans slam farmers — tractors siege Brussels.

events.title: 2025 EU dreams of tech sovereignty
events.summary: Ursula declares ‘Digital Europe’ — then buys all chips from Taiwan.
events.punchline: Speech about independence — hardware from Asia.

events.title: 1949 NATO officially born
events.summary: Alliance forms to stop Soviet expansion — Europe instantly becomes protected vassal zone.
events.punchline: America makes club — Europe salutes forever.

events.title: 1953 CIA–MI6 Iran coup (Operation Ajax)
events.summary: Elected PM Mosaddegh overthrown to protect oil; NATO watches and files tactic for later.
events.punchline: Democracy yes — unless BP says no.

events.title: 1954 Guatemala CIA banana coup
events.summary: NATO friend USA removes socialist president for United Fruit Company.
events.punchline: Protect the banana more than the ballot.

events.title: 1968 Prague Spring crushed by Warsaw Pact
events.summary: Soviets send tanks into Czechoslovakia — NATO does nothing except take notes.
events.punchline: UN gives speech — tanks give reality.

events.title: 1973 Yom Kippur War & oil shock
events.summary: US airlifts to Israel → OPEC cuts oil to NATO countries → recession triggered.
events.punchline: Middle East sneezes → NATO catches recession.

events.title: 1979 USSR invades Afghanistan
events.summary: NATO quietly funds mujahideen to bleed Soviets — creates problems for future NATO.
events.punchline: Operation: make tomorrow’s enemy today’s friend.

events.title: 1989 US invades Panama (Operation Just Cause)
events.summary: NATO pal removes Noriega; aims to show muscle before USSR falls.

events.title: 1995 NATO bombs in Bosnia after UN fails
events.summary: UN peacekeepers useless → NATO finally flexes airpower on Serbs.
events.punchline: When UN does paperwork, NATO does fireworks.

events.title: 1999 NATO Kosovo intervention
events.summary: Serbian forces massacring Albanians → NATO launches justice-by-airstrike.
events.punchline: Human rights delivered via cruise missile.

events.title: 2003 Iraq invasion splits NATO
events.summary: US/UK go in hot, France/Germany shake heads but still guard oil.

events.title: 2009 Gaddafi secretly funds Sarkozy campaign
events.summary: Libyan dictator gives millions to French president who later bombed him.

events.title: 2011 Arab Spring becomes NATO business
events.summary: Tunisia sparks uprisings, NATO ends up bombing Libya again & arming Syria rebels.

events.title: 2014 NATO begins Baltic buildup
events.summary: Troops move east after Crimea — Moscow calls it provocation, NATO calls it ‘defense’.

events.title: 2022 Finland & Sweden rush to NATO
events.summary: Neutral for 70 years — one Putin speech sends them running into NATO’s arms.
events.punchline: From IKEA peace to heavy artillery.

events.title: 1955 Warsaw Pact created
events.summary: Soviets counter NATO — Europe now officially split like a bad divorce.

events.title: 1961 Bay of Pigs humiliation
events.summary: CIA beach invasion in Cuba fails badly — NATO allies pretend they didn’t see.

events.title: 1964 Cyprus crisis
events.summary: Greece & Turkey (both NATO) nearly go to war — alliance breaks out popcorn.

events.title: 1976 Argentina junta US-backed
events.summary: Military dictatorship takes power; NATO friend supplies equipment quietly.
events.punchline: Democracy tour – with stopover in torture cell.

events.title: 1980s NATO Operation Gladio rumours
events.summary: Alleged stay-behind armies tied to false flag ops in Europe.

events.title: 1983 Beirut Marine barracks bombing
events.summary: US & French troops hit in Lebanon — NATO retreats from proxy mess.

events.title: 1989 NATO member Turkey fights PKK
events.summary: Kurds label Ankara oppressive — NATO shrugs, sells weapons anyway.

events.title: 1994 Rwanda genocide ignored
events.summary: UN begs for NATO support — alliance says ‘Africa not our jurisdiction’.
events.punchline: 800,000 dead while West updates fax machine.

events.title: 2006 NATO assumes command in Afghanistan
events.summary: US gets bored — NATO inherits endless guerrilla nightmare.

events.title: 2008 Georgia–Russia war
events.summary: Georgia pokes Russia hoping NATO covers — NATO sends strong tweets instead.

events.title: 2014 Donbas conflict begins
events.summary: Russia backs rebels, NATO arms Kyiv quietly as test lab for weapons.

events.title: 2018 Skripal poisoning in UK
events.summary: Russian ex-spy poisoned — NATO expels diplomats, keeps gas flowing.

events.title: 2020 NATO adds ‘space’ as fifth domain
events.summary: Alliance prepares for war among satellites while Earth still on fire.

events.title: 2023 NATO-trained Mali soldiers join Russian side
events.summary: Mali troops once trained by West later partner Wagner Group.
events.punchline: Trained by NATO — freelance for Moscow.

events.title: 1960 Congo PM Lumumba assassinated
events.summary: US & Belgium allegedly help kill anti-colonial leader to protect mining interests.

events.title: 1964 Brazil military coup
events.summary: US greenlights overthrow of Goulart to prevent ‘communism’ — dictatorship lasts 21 years.

events.title: 1973 Chile’s Pinochet coup
events.summary: CIA backs overthrow of Allende — ushers in neoliberal terror.

events.title: 1975–2002 Angola civil war
events.summary: Cold War proxy bloodbath: US & South Africa vs USSR & Cuba.

events.title: 1980s El Salvador death squad war
events.summary: USA funds military fighting ‘communists’ — peasants suffer massacres.

events.title: 1981–1990 Nicaragua Contra War
events.summary: Reagan arms right-wing rebels to topple Sandinistas; UN condemns.
events.punchline: Peasants caught between rice and rockets.

events.title: 1998 Second Congo War erupts
events.summary: Nine African countries join — minerals & paranoia drive slaughter.

events.title: 2001 Plan Colombia launched
events.summary: US funds Colombian army to fight cartels & FARC — villagers bombed accidentally.

events.title: 2004 Darfur genocide begins
events.summary: UN ‘concerned’, NATO considers action, nobody intervenes — 300,000 dead.

events.title: 2008 M23 rebel crisis in Congo
events.summary: Rebels allegedly backed by Rwanda/Uganda — Western firms keep mining happily.
events.punchline: Coltan for your phone — soaked in blood.

events.title: 2011 Ivory Coast post-election war
events.summary: France intervenes militarily to protect ‘democracy’ and cocoa trade.

events.title: 2019 attempts to topple Maduro
events.summary: US recognises random opposition leader as president — plan goes nowhere.

events.title: 2021 Mozambique gas field insurgency
events.summary: ISIS-linked rebels hit LNG projects; NATO ally Portugal trains commandos.

events.title: 2023 Sudan power struggle
events.summary: Russia, UAE, US circle chaos as generals fight over gold mines.
